column4: Hey there. I just built a fairly powerful machine for my little brother, and I'm putting Ubuntu on it. In the past I've had trouble with nodes in Edgy. Have there been recent updates to it? Should I go with Dapper?
device nodes.
Namely wireless controllers and such, but it could happen to anything, I'd imagine, if the problem isn't driver-related.
And it probably isn't, since Dapper used the same driver and didn't have the problem. Anyway, this isn't about that problem, it's about whether I should put Edgy or Dapper on it.
This is a computer I want to leave him when I move away. He'll no doubt be upgrading it to newer versions eventually, but I want to make sure it's reliable.
By the way, I think you guys switched to gscreensaver way too early. It's pretty lousy at the moment in that it lacks many screensavers and is generally incompatible with xscreensavers.
I completely agree
Pici, soundray  - I personally find that the gscreensaver's lack of ability to edit the settings for each screensaver is most irritating
I think you can tinker with the .desktop files and adjust some settings there. All in all, though, it ought to still be called a beta.
yep - something that I've always thought was not exactly the most user friendly.
